briefTitle: Study of Recombinant Coagulation Factor IX Fc Fusion Protein, BIIB029, in Previously Treated Pediatric Participants With Hemophilia B
officialTitle: An Open-label, Multicenter Evaluation of Safety, Pharmacokinetics and Efficacy of Recombinant Coagulation Factor IX Fc Fusion Protein, BIIB029, in the Prevention and Treatment of Bleeding Episodes in Pediatric Subjects With Hemophilia B

interventions.name: rFIXFc
otherNames: recombinant coagulation factor IX Fc fusion protein

summary: The primary objective of the study is to evaluate the safety of Recombinant Human Coagulation Factor IX Fc Fusion Protein (rFIXFc) in previously treated pediatric subjects with hemophilia B. Secondary objectives of this study in this study population are as follows: to evaluate the efficacy of rFIXFc for prevention and treatment of bleeding episodes; to evaluate and assess the pharmacokinetics (PK) of rFIXFc; to evaluate rFIXFc consumption for prevention and treatment of bleeding episodes

primaryOutcome.measure: Occurence of Factor IX (FIX) Inhibitor Development
primaryOutcome.timeFrame: Up to 50 weeks +/- 7 days, or up to 50 EDs if reached prior to Week 50
